Kat was too out of it to jump, so she turned around drunkenly, stumbling toward the table while Jessica stood in the doorway to the kitchen. She had a smug look on her plump face and was holding a glass vile up to her face, examining it with interest. Kat's first instinct was to say "'Oh my' what, tubby?" but she stopped herself. Her and Sean might mock the unfortunate overweight people in the outside world, but even Kat was self aware enough to know it wouldn't be polite to do it in a person's own home.

"That's a whole lot of food you have there, Kat," Jessica said, waiting for Kat to notice the vile and ask about it.

She plopped them down on the table and considered Jessica's words. Yes, it was an awful lot of food. But she was hungry after all. She ate when she was hungry. Ate until she had enough and then stopped. This healthy eating style, combined with her vigorous work out routine, kept her body in its lean, toned shape that she was so proud of.

"What of it?" she asked, almost sneering. She didn't want to be outright rude to her boyfriend's sister, but she was simply too hammered to be extra nice.

"It's just, you already look a little . . . "she paused, glancing to Kat's stomach for effect, "bloated."

Kat looked down. Her stomach did look puffy, it's true. Her clingy tank top rode up just a bit over her slightly rounded stomach, which pushed down her sweat pants just slightly. She rubbed it, covering her mouth with a belch. She knew she should be at least moderately embarrassed, and in the back of her mind she was. But in the front of her mind, all she wanted to do was sit down and eat, which she did.

She opened a packet of ham and began digging into it, slice by slice. In between pieces she took a spoon to a pie, then a big gulp of soda to wash it down. No thought towards the strange combinations of foods. It felt automatic, like she couldn't control herself. She took the milk and began drinking, and drinking, until that too was nearly empty.

A deep gurgle erupted from her stomach. She slammed the milk down and winced, doubling over in her chair. A few small, low burps followed by a groan.

Jessica still stood there, leaning against the doorway, holding that vile--

"Whaat?" Kat slurred. "Bwaaaaa--aaarp!" She wrapped her arms around her stomach. She swore she could feel it was rounder than it was earlier. She certainly felt stuffed, full, bloated . . .

Kat's wave of nausea passed, and she took a few giant spoonfuls of the pie, took a huge bite of lunch meat without even separating the pieces, chugged the rest of the milk.

She belched again, leaning back in her chair. Her one hand massaged her poor, stuffed tummy, tugging down her shirt to cover it.

"Kat, don't you think you're overdoing it? I'll bet you've never eaten like this in your life."

Your fat influence, probably, Kat thought, smiling at her little joke.

"And you're still eating, even though your obviously full, mmm?" Jessica entered the room nonchalantly, waving the vile in her hand.

"What's that?" Kat finally asked, taking the pie into her lap so she could eat and lean back at the same time. "And what's it to you anyways?" she asked between bites.

"What do you think it'd be like to have no self control? To have to stuff your face until you can't move every time food was around? To have to keep doing that even when you can feel your body growing fatter everyday, and no matter how hard you try to stop your body just won't listen, because it's decided you're going to eat, and that's final?"

"Urrrrrp!" Kat finished the pie. Her tummy so stuffed she could actually see it, a disgusting little food baby poking up from her shirt. "Sounds like a nightmare." In her drunken, hungry stupor something clicked. "W-why?"

Her stuffed stomach growled, the hunger pangs growing stronger immediately.

But now, she just wanted to finish her little snack of . . . several pounds of meat . . . an entire pie . . . a tray of doughnuts . . . a gallon of milk . . .

The next week was the only full week where Kat really gave a shit.

All week, she basically starved herself. Even though she was eating more than she ever had before. it felt like a crash diet; unless she looked overdue with twins, she found, she stomach would roar and gurgle all day, making her feel as if her own stomach was eating the rest of her alive. It only took until the proceeding week until she finally broke. Her parents found her one morning, lying against the fridge; she'd polished off a full set of leftover ribs, two cases of soda, one case of beer, fourteen doughnuts, twelve hot dogs with all the trimmings she could find, two potato chip bags, and half a cake. She was enormous, and sloshy, and terribly gassy, but she had such a look of contentment. For the time being, her belly stopped aching with hunger.

After a single binge meal, her rail-thin tummy stopped being so taut, a plush starter belly rising up in its place. Working out just made her even hungrier, and it didn't matter how much she starved herself. Once pudge appeared on her belly, it wasn't going away.

It took one more binge. She woke up, even fatter, lying against the fridge one morning, the list of things she'd downed the prior night longer, her mother looking down on her, disappointed. "Well... How do you feel?" she asked Kat in a condescending tone.

That's when it hit her. Not only was her belly not gnawing at her, but she felt... stretched full, and wide, and warm. She felt more of her ass than she'd ever felt before, pooled out underneath her on the kitchen linoleum. Her whole body felt softer, like she'd eaten a huge marshmallow, one that was so big it filled her up and stretched her out so much that she was a marshmallow... The only ache she could feel was gas in her tummy, and that was easily relieved.
"...Good..." she purred, before belching.


After that, Kat even started forgetting why she'd started getting fat in the first place. “This is, like, literally the stupidest thing in the I’ve ever heard.” Kat said crossly to no one in particular, “I didn’t even know this dead lady. This is so fake.”

It wasn’t exactly the most unpopular opinion in the room, either. Everyone in the Farmington family had gathered in the rinky-dink lawyer’s office to witness the reading of one Rhonda Burkhart’s last will and testament, having received several phone calls and letters from the handler of her estate. The only problem was that nobody had ever heard of Rhonda Burkhart before a few weeks ago, despite her bearing Kat’s mother’s maiden name. Everyone was content in simply shredding the letters until Mrs. Peasely, the late Rhonda Burkhart’s lawyer, managed to get Kat’s father on the phone and informed them that the Farmington family stood to inherit a sum of money from the passing of their beloved family member. Naturally this piqued Doug’s interest, as it did his wife and three daughters of similar covetous nature, and everyone immediately took an interest in the matter.

They had been sitting, standing, or otherwise occupying Mrs. Peasely’s office for a good twenty minutes while she shuffled off in search of the will.

Doug sat on the business end of the lawyer’s desk, one foot bobbing impatiently as he crossed his legs. His sharp gray suit looked (and was) expensive, and his thick black hair was cut to precisely imitate the look of whomever had been on the latest issue of GQ. Beneath his meticulously groomed goatee, Doug frowned at his daughter’s sudden suspicion.

“Settle down, Kat.” Her father said sternly, “We’ll know soon enough if it’s fake or not, and you getting all pouty isn’t going to make this go any faster.”

Next to Doug sat Melissa, his wife and Kat’s mother. She was a rigid-looking woman, with a chiseled jaw and pronounced cheekbones that leant a certain sense of hardness about her. She was, nevertheless, stunningly beautiful. One could have easily believed that she was modeling her business ensemble rather than wearing it, wiping the proverbial blood from her sleeve after another corporate takeover. Her own hair, also black, was cut into a stylish bob that curled in front of her ears and accentuated the diamond-like shape of her face. She had spent the last twenty minutes alternating between taking curt business calls and admonishing her daughters for various perceived faults to take the edge off of her teeming curiosity.

“Quite the opposite, actually.” She said in a surly tone, “Honestly Doug, this is really something for adults to discuss anyway. I don’t understand why we had to bring the children.”

“Mrs. Peasely said that every member of our family has to be present, and that includes the girls.” Doug’s attention faded towards his phone as he absently continued, “Believe me, I asked.”

Behind Doug and Melissa were the Farmington girls, their daughters, who were equally as unenthused to be here as their parents. Kat and Patricia took to the two chairs that Mrs. Peasely had set up against the wall, while Joann leaned against the bookshelf.

Had their parents not been present, it wouldn’t have been hard to tell the three girls were related. They all had their father’s thick black hair, Kat and Patricia wore it long while Joann had hers cut a little closer to the shoulders, and they all possessed their mother’s strong features and sharp eyes. Joann took more after their father, her rounded nose and naturally fairer skin inherited from his side of the family, and she was of a taller and skinnier sort of build than her sisters. Kat and Patricia were 100% Burkhart women, through and through. They both had similar facial structures, their mother’s pointier nose, and slightly tanned complexion mesh. Beyond that, they had both filled out considerably more than Joann had, with both Kat having developed full round breasts before her Sophomore year in high school, and Patricia having just recently come into hers. Just one of the many perks that came with swimming in the deep end of the Burkhart gene pool.

“Daddy, can we go yet?” Patricia piped up from her phone, apparently having not been paying very good attention, “It’s taking her forever!”

“Not now, Patti.” Doug said flatly, hardly as attentive in correcting his youngest daughter’s whining as he was in correcting Kat’s, “She’ll be here soon enough.”

“She better.” Joann said gruffly as she looked up from her own smartphone, “The girls from my sorority are going out tonight and I am not missing out because some fatass can’t find my dead great-aunt’s will.”

An annoyed huff escaped Melissa, who turned around to face her daughter in the swivel chair. It was a habit she’d picked up in her flair for dramatics in the office, and a fine example of Mrs. Farmington taking her work home with her to keep in practice.

“You’re going out with those girls again?” Melissa asked sharply, looking up at her eldest daughter with her thin black brow raised, “Tell me you’re not going to drink. With all those empty calories in beer and how often you seem to go out with them, I’d start to worry about your girlish figure if I were you.”

There was an extended silence as Joann looked to the other members of her family to come to her defense, but they were all otherwise preoccupied with their various smart devices. Even her father, who usually at least defended the meaner remarks her mother made in his presence, seemed too preoccupied by going over the digital copy of the letter Mrs. Peasely had sent him. Her mother slowly whipped her phone back out and swiveled back around. Kat watched as Joann rolled her eyes, let out a huff, and went back to texting.

Within minutes, the doorknob slowly turned as a sixth person entered the room. She was a short, plump woman dressed in a modest blazer and skirt in the same gray color as Kat’s father. She had her brown hair in an updo, exaggerating the chubbiness of her cheeks as she smiled professionally at all the unpleasant people in her office. The Farmington family parted so as to allow the chubby lawyer some wiggle room as she made her way back behind her desk. Kat would have estimated Mrs. Peasely to be around her mother’s age, without the benefit of personal trainers or professional stylists. Which was a shame, because she was certain that Mrs. Peasely could have been just as pretty if she wasn’t so friggin’ fat.

“Hi, sorry about the delay.” The chubby woman said happily once she was resituated behind the desk, “I asked my new secretary to keep it safe for me. Ms. Burkhart was an extraordinary woman and a close personal friend, I wanted to be sure that I handled this case personally… I’m very sorry for your loss.”

“Whatever, can we just get on with it?” Kat puffed indignantly, “We’ve been here for like, forty minutes and—“

“Katherine!” Melissa shouted from across the office before whipping back around to face Mrs. Peasely, “I apologize for my daughter’s rudeness Mrs. Pugsley. Please, continue.”

“It’s quite alright, I understand that given the… circumstances surrounding your strained relationship with Ms. Burkhart. It might be a little hard to wrap your heads around all this.” She shuffled through her gathered papers and pulled out a cluster that had been paperclipped together, “I’ve been instructed to read you this letter—hopefully it should shine some light on your relations with my client.”

Mrs. Peasely cleared her throat as the Farmington family sat complacently in their seats, three out of the five of them completely apathetic to the situation entirely. Never the less, Mrs. Peasely continued to read off Rhonda Burkhart’s letter despite the constant interruptions of vibrating cell phones.

Dearest Melissa—

I’m aware that this might come as something of a shock to you, considering that as far as your mother was ever concerned you never had an Aunt Rhonda. But ever since you were a little girl, I’ve loved you like you were my own daughter, even if my sister kept us apart. While you probably don’t remember them, those weekends you spent over at my house baking cakes and eating sugar cookies meant the world to me, and I’ve spent the last few years thinking about how much I wish I had been a part of your life past those five short years when I was still allowed to be in it.

Obviously, that would be quite a feat considering when this letter has been instructed to reach you, but I digress.

I always regretted letting your mother keep us apart, and I truly apologize for not putting my foot down and insisting to be a part of your life. While I’m afraid it’s too late to spend Sunday morning licking the pancake batter off the beaters, there are other ways in which I can show you how much you mean to me despite my current state.

I am (was) a woman of great wealth and culinary talent, and nothing made me happier than to see your chubby little face smiling as you ate everything I put in front of you. I’ve made millions making people happy with my cooking, selling my recipes, patenting my own line of cookware, and financing a few restaurants—but nothing would make me happier (or piss off my sister more) than to see you and your family smile like that again.

My last request, as a loving aunt who wanted nothing more than to be allowed to love her favorite niece, is that—by one year’s time—you or a member of your immediate family weigh at least three hundred pounds. And in return, I will bequeath my fortune to whomever the lucky gourmand is.

Thank you, my favorite little taste-tester, for hearing out my dying request.

Lovingly yours,
Aunt Rhonda.
There was a stunned silence as Mrs. Peasely finished reading the letter aloud, all three of the Farmington daughters having dropped their phones in respect of the strange final request of their great aunt that no one knew they had. Doug and Melissa, even, were similarly silent. Melissa certainly did not remember any of those mornings, cakes, cookies, and she certainly never remembered ever being “chubby”!

“You must be joking.” The Farmington matriarch growled at the chair-squashing office drone before her, “I do not have an Aunt Rhonda, and even if I did, I’m sure she wouldn’t be so unstable as to donate her entire fortune for me if I get fat!”

“This is ridiculous. A sick joke.” Doug shot up from his chair and started towards the door, “Come on girls, we’re leaving… can’t believe I left work early for this…”

“I assure you, Mr. and Mrs. Farmington, that my client’s… strange request is entirely legitimate!” she said in a hurried tone as she stood up from her chair, “I have the account information to prove it, and it’s all been instructed to go to whomever—if you’ll just listen!“

Mrs. Farmington rolled her eyes and stood from her seat with ease, ushering her daughters to rise with silent fingers as she pushed towards the door. Doug was already out in the lobby, and she was soon to follow with Kat and her sisters.

“I’m sure whomever hired you for this… farce will be disappointed in my lack of compliance, but no one in my family is going to get fat!” Melissa said sharply, “End. Of. Story.”

Kat was more than ready to go. She was already late for her date with Sean, and this whole thing was really more of her Mom and Dad’s deal anyway. She happily dragged Patricia up from her seat and practically yanked her out the door.

“6.2 Billion!” Mrs. Peasely suddenly shouted, bringing all eyes back onto her, “6.2 Billion dollars… is what you stand to inherit from Ms. Burkhart’s estate.”

Needless to say, this announcement brought everyone back into Mrs. Peasely’s office with surprising speed. Doug and Melissa practically dragged their daughters back into the room and sat them down, intent on listening to every last detail of what Melissa’s dearly departed aunt had to give them upon her unfortunate demise. Kat and her sisters, too, listened as eagerly as their parents. The promise of six-point-two billion dollars within reach had a way of garnering some attention.

“Now then—your aunt, Ms. Rhonda Burkhart, has left me with detailed instructions as to the handling of her estate.” Mrs. Peasely adjusted her glasses as she glanced over the papers in her hands, “Said estate includes her mansion, bank accounts, off-shore bank accounts, the rights to her likeness, the patent on her line of culinary equipment, executive control of her various businesses, and all of her earthly possessions; which roughly translates into 6.2 billion dollars, American.”

The thought of all that money was salivatingly delicious. Doug and Melissa were rich, but they certainly weren’t billionaires. With his head for investing and her bloodthirsty office behavior, they could easily invest that money and get even more rich than they stood to become!

“Upon the transfer of Ms. Burkhart’s estate, it will be yours to do with as you see fit. Though she does include an addendum expressing her desire that her fortune be spent wisely.” The chubby lawyer lady continued flatly, “Ms. Burkhart also states that—“

“Enough already, just explain how we get the money!” Kat said suddenly, much to the distaste of the three adults in the room.

“Katherine, I’m surprised at you!” Doug admonished loudly, “Your dear great aunt—God rest her soul—has left us a great large gift and I cannot believe that you, her grant-niece, are so shallow that you can’t—“

“Oh enough, Doug. We’re not in court.” Mrs. Farmington rolled her eyes, “Get to the point, how do we get the money?”

Mrs. Peasely straightened her papers in her hand, adjusted her glasses, and flipped through the pages. She glanced over one, then put it to the back of the pile. Glanced over that one, back of the pile. She continued in silence to spite the Farmington family, who watched on in avaricious agony as she tested their patience. Eventually, she found the correct document.

“It says here that in order to inherit the deceased’s estate, you must fulfill the following requirements.” She began, “You must be a blood relative to Ms. Burkhart, and you must weigh at least three hundred pounds. If one party fails to achieve the specified weight of three hundred pounds, it will go to the next most qualified heir. Should no potential heir reach the specified within a year’s time, the money will go various charities or back into her companies. If a potential heir does reach the specified weight, but is not of age, the money will go to their legal guardian—so long as that legal guardian is Melissa.”

Doug frowned, “So this will was designed to screw me out of inheritance, then.”

“S-So I have to gain…” Melissa gulped “T-Two hundred pounds in a year’s time or… or—“

Kat sniggered at the thought of her mother getting fat. Getting huge. She pictured her as a big round ball with four or five chins with stubby little arms and legs popping out of her business suit, all sweaty and gross. That would be hilarious.

“It all goes to charity.” Mrs. Peasely said flatly, “But it doesn’t actually say it has to be you, Mrs. Farmington. My client said that anyone in your immediate family is eligible to participate. The one who reaches the goal weight and can maintain it by this time next year stands to inherit the fortune.”

“What does that mean?” Melissa asked intently, slamming her hands down on the desk, “Does that mean there’s a way I can do this without blowing up like a balloon?”

“Well… yes and no.” Mrs. Peasely continued, shuffling some papers in response to the Farmington matriarch’s display of power, “If one of your daughters reaches the aforementioned weight, I suppose it would technically belong to you until they turned eighteen. Otherwise the money would belong to them.”

Kat perked up. She was eighteen—did that mean she stood a chance to get six-billion-dollar rich?

“So… lemme get this straight.” Patricia said suddenly from her seat, “If I gain two hundred pounds, I’ll get the money?”

“Patricia!” Her mother hissed coarsely, “Please, now is not the time for—“

“Well, no. Unless you’re eighteen.” Mrs. Peasely said calmly, ignoring Mrs. Farmington’s outburst, “Your mother would inherit the money on your behalf… should you meet the requirements by this time next year.”

“Oh Patricia!” Her mother crooned with sickening sweetness as she hurried over to her daughter’s side, stroking the top of her head lovingly as she hunched over to hug the taken-aback teen, “You’re such a smart girl. So sweet…and thin. You were always Mommy's favorite!”

There was some ruckus in the office. Doug was naturally upset that, beyond whatever perks he got from being in Melissa’s presence, he stood to gain nothing from this whole affair. Joann was busy interrogating Mrs. Peasely about the suspicious nature of the whole ordeal, and Melissa was cooing loudly about how Patricia was her favorite child while Patricia was expressing her lacking desire to ruin her perfect body so her mother could become a billionaire. It was getting unseasonably loud in the office until finally Kat piped up—

“So, like, what if I do it?” she said as the room went quiet, “Like, I’m eighteen. Does that mean I get to keep the money?”

“Um… I believe so.” Mrs. Peasely broke away from Joann to shuffle her papers some more, “So long as you gain the required weight in time and are of age, you are a potential heir to Ms. Burkhart’s estate.”

“Katherine don’t you dare even think about it! She’s my aunt and it’s my money!” her mother roared before turning back to Patricia, “Come on girls, let’s head home. Mrs. Peasely and I will discuss all this later away from listening ears… Come on Patti, let’s go get you a milkshake or something.”

Patrica nodded, and then continued punctuating the end of every sentence with a helping of food, be it burger chocolate shake or frenched fry, often all three. “Yep, and I figure why not. Oh you know Mom and Dad will take care of you two…down the line after they get it...She said she was just making sure you ended working as hard as they did to get where they are now, pulling yourself up by your own bootstraps, college, internships that sort of thing, not being afraid to get your hands dirty…I sort of spaced out.

“And you?”

Patricia took her time savoring and munching this particular mouthful before smiling as she nearly nuzzled another French fry, “We just worked it out so that… Well, you know since I am the one who’s going along with crazy plan. I ought to get a little MORE out of it.”

There it was and the now that the other shoe had dropped it stopped Kat’s blood cold. Stay calm…Play your cards… she reminded herself. How could she compete with an offer like that…thinking about it, Kat figured she must have gotten her social skills from her mother. Because Kat didn’t get to the top of the school popularity ladder by being nice, she got it by stomping down all the competition, weather it was spreading rumors, gossip, or most of the time just outright lying, she made sure none of the other cheerleaders shined as brightly as she did. Yeah, she totally could.

*Gulp* “Yeah...It’s like billions of dollars here. Mom and I both of no trouble with gaining all that weight for-”

“-No I mean about mom and dad sharing the money with you…”

*Cough Cough* Pat spluttered and released the soon to be devoured handful of fries she was about to eat. “Why would they do that?! I mean why wouldn’t they do that?” she near shouted, all smugness gone from her tone.

“Please. I’m sure you can guess Mom and Dad can think of a billion ways to keep you from getting a billion dollars.” Not exactly lying, but stirring up enough strife with just a bit of truth in the mix.

“L-like what?”

“Like, uh,,, investments and stuff, you know. Billions of stock of their own company, that sort of tricky cursed genie or gypsy wish thing.”

“N-no way…”

“Did you get in writing?” asked Kat, now confident enough to reach across the table and helping herself to some fries.

“…N-no.” said Patricia her head downwards and shrinking up on herself a bit.

"Oh really, so say you do somehow do the impossible and make it to 300lbs, which you know, by the way is so going to wreck you figure. Do you really think mom’s the kind of person who’ll just hand it over to you?”

"Sure she will me and Mom are like so special. A-and t it’s not like mom’s going to do it herself and somehow take it from me, and she’s not going to let the chance at billions of dollars go by either, even if it does go completely against all the health food and fitness training she's thrown at us for all our life. "That’s why I’m perfect.” Assured Pat, having dug in to this dogma of thinking, she sat firm and content.

Kat was corned, It was risky to reveal her plan like this… but it was well worth the chance. “Well maybe…. but maybe there’s another way…”

“Who Joan? Or like, You? …Seriously?"

Kat had no way out now…”You’ll still only be seventeen next year, and just have to trust mom on her good word she’ll give you your share, but legally it’s hers to do with whatever she pleases. But, well, unlike you, I’ll be nineteen well past legal age next year, so I’d get all the money to myself to do with it whatever I want. Even share it with a sister who helped me out..."

Pat froze. “So what? You’re going to somehow gain two hundred pounds WITHOUT Mom noticing?”

“Well, I figure enough before she starts noticing what’s really going on, then…maybe…” here she trailed off, not having thought that far ahead…

“Hmph” pouted Patrica in self-satisfied victory.

“Look all I’m saying is just help me, instead of helping her.”

“-Help you…how exactly?"

“I don’t know just cover for me, any extra food mom sends your way sneak it over to me, that sort of deal, and I’ll give you a fourth of the inheritance."

“A fourth!?” said Patricia in an incredulously snooty shout.

Kat kept her nerve however, again the Farmington blood flowing through her veins at a breakneck speed. “Hey it’s a fourth of it all guaranteed, or a maybe nothing with Mom… I’ll put mine in Legit in writing too. Like on one of those contracts in Mom and Dad’s filing cabinet…A-and that way you don’t have to wreck your body. I mean you only turn eighteen once, do you want to do it at 300lbs…” Kat had put it all out on the line, and now she could only hold her breath as she waited for her spoiled sibling answer...

155312221121112221.content:
She know knew quite well that her sister Patricia had already ballooned from her starting weight of 112 pounds all the way up to 127 pounds, a fifteen pound gain in three weeks—triple what Kat had gained in that same time.

Kat could still practically hear her mother swooning over Patricia’s monumental weight gain. Kat and Patricia’s rooms were only a bathroom apart from one another, and their mother wasn’t exactly the softest speaker, so she tended to get an inadvertent update at almost every weigh-in she was unwittingly present for. Their mother had rewarded Patricia’s “hard work” with a trip to WacDonalds, while Kat was forced to sneak toaster pastries behind her back just to score a decent breakfast.

Nobody in the Farmington household had ever been more than ten pounds overweight at any point in time, and yet Kat’s mother constantly lambasted her for every little indulgence like she was a heart attack waiting to happen. Now that Patricia was actively working to put on two hundred pounds as quickly as possible, Kat somehow seemed to get treated even worse than when her mother had no reason to worry. Their mother kept the fridge and cabinets stocked with anything and everything that would add ample inches to Patricia’s frame, and yet Kat still got served cold beet juice and wheatgrass shakes with dinner.

“Joann, be nice. Your sister’s just hungry.” Doug said unconvincingly as he sawed through his steak, “I’m sure it doesn’t have anything to do with that… ridiculous will reading. Right, sweetie?”

“UrrURp!” Patricia belched thickly as she placed the half-empty glass of milk down on the table “Exactly. Thank you, Daddy.”

“You’re welcome, sweetpea.”

Kat watched with narrowed eyes as Patricia continued to chomp her way through the substantial steak that their housekeeper had plopped in front of her. Her little sister had been eating like a queen all day, and yet somehow found the strength to muster herself through two helpings of Maria’s heavy dinner. Kat had been stuffing herself all week in hopes of stretching her stomach a little, but she was just now almost done with her initial plate and she felt like she was going to hurl. It turned out that ruining her perfectly sculpted cheerleader body was going to be a lot harder than she thought.

“Oh come on Daddy, you and Mom are obviously overfeeding Patti so she’ll fatten up enough so you can get the money, but—newsflash!—it’s all a bunch of bull.” Joann bemoaned, “Seriously, how can you even believe that some dead lady cares how much Mom or whoever weighs?”

“I have no idea what you’re talking about, Joann.” Doug said with an impressive flatline to his tone as he took a minute to check his phone, “But I say if your sister’s hungry, let her eat.”

“Weren’t you going shopping?” Her mother’s tone turned indifferent as her attention shifted towards one of her non-profitable daughters, “If you’re going to go, then go. You don’t have to leave on such a scene every time you’re going somewhere.”

Joann simply slouched down in her chair, crossing her arms and frowning in disgust at her parents’ treatment of their daughter. Kat had been paying special attention to how much Joann had been eating these past few weeks too, ensuring that all her big-talk about how stupid the whole inheritance thing sounded wasn’t just a clever ploy to throw suspicion off her trail. From what she’d seen, Joann seemed to be out of the game, but Kat wasn’t ready to take her eyes off of her older sister just yet…

“Who wants dessert?”

The announcement tore Kat from her inward assessment, turning her head to see her mother returning from behind the kitchen counter with a big silver tin of key lime pie. Kat’s number one on the worst desserts ever list, but everyone else in the family loved it. Dessert was another one of those special things that used to be just once in a while, but were quickly becoming commonplace in wake of the will reading. Their mother was pulling out all the stops in her efforts to plump Patti up to three hundred pounds, and it definitely showed.

“I do!” Patricia announced proudly as she pushed her empty plate away, “Oh wow, is that key lime pie?”

“I sure did!” Mrs. Farmington said pleasantly as she placed the pie in the middle of the table and whipped out a knife, “Maria said it was on sale, and I told her to get it for us because I knew it was your favorite!”

Kat watched as her mother cut into the pie. She wouldn’t have put it past her to just hand Patti the whole thing and let her go whole hog on it, but apparently everyone was trying really hard to not outwardly look like shitty parents who were fattening up their daughter for money. Mrs. Farmington cut two good-sized pieces for her and her husband, a small slice for Joann, and then just straight up handed the tin to Patricia, who clapped her hands in greedy approval.

“Mm… oh I’m sorry Kat, I didn’t think you’d want any.” Her mother teasingly said after her first bite of key lime pie, “I know you don’t really care for this… mm! scrumptious little dish. And besides, now that school’s out you’ve got to keep that cheerleader body trim! We wouldn’t want you to pork out over the Summer, now would we?”

This was of course juxtaposed with Patricia pigging out on a little more than half of a whole pie, a whole fifteen pounds heavier than she had been a month ago, which made Melissa’s parenting style look as schizophrenic as it was exploitative. Kat and Joann exchanged a passing glance at one another, an identical look they’d learned to do in their mother’s more irrational moments. One black brow raised with full pursed lips may as well have been a secret handshake in the Farmington household.

Kat only had forty-eight weeks to gain a little less than two hundred pounds, and if she kept going at this rate, Patricia was going to beat her to the billions! She had to do something to level the playing field…

"YES!" Kat shouted as she jumped off the scale in her bathroom. It had read 10 pounds closer to her goal for the money, something she was not expecting after only 4 days of indulging with Ken. Then again... Kat looked around her room and saw an empty box of pizza, chip wrappers, 3 containers of chocolate milk and 2 containers of heavy cream. She blushed as she walked by the full length mirror in her room and noticed the layer of pudge forming across her middle, sticking out over her underwear as she walked to her closet. She paused and did a once over of her new body, cringing when she saw what only 10 pounds has done. Her butt was still just as nice as ever, maybe a little bit softer but nothing to be concerned about. Her legs were noticeably softer and there was a bit more meat there than she'd like, but the biggest change overall was her belly, which jiggled ever so slightly with each step.

She walked to the closet where there was already a pile of jeans she was attempting to put on, only to find that each button was more stubborn than the last. Kat then decided it was time to check the scale. The 10 pounds really explained why none of them fit anymore so she resorted to a pair of sweats and an old shirt that covered her belly bulge. She may be gaining weight, but she was no where near ready for the rest of the world to find out.

"Kat dear, will you come here?" She heard her mother screaming from the kitchen. Her mom spent nearly every waking moment in the kitchen these days to fatten up lil Patricia. To Kat's dismay, her mom's attempts had been working much better than she had hoped. Kat trudged down to her mother's calls, noticing how the force of each downward step sent her belly in a bounce.

When she got to the Kitchen Kat saw her mom pulling out a large cake, dabbing her finger in the frosting and licking it off with a smile, "Patricia is going to love this wont she?" Kat smiled forcefully, knowing full well that she might only get one bite, maybe two if she were lucky. Kat followed her mom into the dining room where her little sister was already at the table eating a hearty pot pie. Kat's mom lay the cake down in front of her and watched as she took to it with a fork and reckless abandon. Minutes passed as Kat sat in awe, not even aware that her own measly portion of dinner was in front of her. With a loud belch her little sister announced that she was done with the cake. Kat looked up from her empty plate of pot pie and was shocked to see a little less than half the cake remained.

"Well if you are full, I can take the rest" Kat said nonchalantly as she stood from the table to get it.

"Hold on young lady," Kat's mom said, rising from her seat and darting to the cake faster than ever. "Wait for everyone else to get a slice." She then cut off slices for her other sisters as well as herself and her dad. Kat wasn't surprised to see her cake slice was the smallest of the groups, but rejoiced when her sisters said they didn't want there piece and neither did her dad. Kat's mom's color left her face as Kat reached for all 3 of the slices to put on her own plate.

"Well hold on dear," Kat's mom said. "I think I would like those pieces, I've worked hard and I am your mother after all." With that Kat's mom took the pieces right out from underneath her and began to eat them gingerly. Doing whatever she could to get Kat from ingesting more calories than necessary. Kat watched, knowing her mom would give in soon enough and then she could take the cake for herself. She continued watching as one slice disappeared, followed by a second, and a third, and finally the last bite of her mothers original piece was eaten with a painful expression from her mom.

Her mother stifled a burp and sighed as she leaned back in her chair. "Well that was delicious, now that everyone's had their fill, let's relax!"

Kat stormed off to her room for the rest of the night...
